p: The majority of the population interviewed ( n = 491, 89.6%) used specifically medicinal plants to treat a disease or a health disorder, from which 20.1% ( n = 110) were habitual (more than 4 times/month) consumers and 69.5% ( n = 381) were occasional users (1–4 times/month). Only 10.4% of respondents ( n = 57) had never consumed medicinal plants in the last 12 months (Table 2).
